results.title: The Removalists
results.brief_description: The story is the tragedy of a young police constable, new to the force and tongue-tied with inhibitions. Circumstances move him to murder, not only of a man, but also of his own morality. The dialogue - screenplay by David Williamson - is a unique combination of irony, cynicism, naivety and vulgar vitality, and the film explores subtle relationships. Based on the play by David Williamson. Stars John Hargreaves, Peter Cummins, Kate Fitzpatrick, Jacki Weaver and Chris Haywood.

results.title: The Remarkable school house
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Shows new teaching methods in use, particularly computer applications, and discusses the changes in schools to be expected in coming decades. Reporter Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Remarkable riderless runaway tricycle
results.creator_credit: Evergreen Productions, John Sturner and Gary Templeton
results.brief_description: A humorous fantasy about a little boy’s tricycle which is mistakenly picked up by garbage collectors and taken to the tip. However, the tricycle mysteriously takes on a personality and a will of its own, escapes from the tip and returns to its owner - but not before having aroused the suspicion of the garbage collectors and the police road patrol. Based on the book by Bruce McNillan.

results.title: The Remarkable bandicoots
results.creator_credit: David Moore, Peter Du Cane, Film Centre (Perth, W.A.) and Wildfilm Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
Until 1930 the Rabbit-Eared Bandicoot, or Bilby, was relatively common in various parts of Australia but suddenly it disappeared from many of them. Today it is the subject of an intensive search and study sponsored by the World Wildlife Fund. The program investigates the history and mystery of this beautiful marsupial. Narrated by David Moore.

results.title: The Remains of the day
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Merchant Ivory Productions, Ismail Merchant, Mike Nichols, John Calley and James Ivory
results.brief_description: Kazuo Ishiguro’s novel is lovingly brought to the screen in this lavish and finely crafted study of English class relations. Anthony Hopkins, in a stunning Academy Award nominated performance, is a butler who has been a gentleman’s gentleman: propriety and service are everything. Even his master’s sympathies for the emerging Nazi Party in Germany do not affect his work. However, on looking back at his life he decides that he was mistaken to choose his work over his emotional attachment to the only woman he has loved (Emma Thompson). Slipping back and forth from the late 1950s to the late 1930s, “Remains of the Day” is both an affecting romance and a sharp and sometimes very sad, very touching examination of how the British class system trapped people into a betrayal of their individual aspirations. It is also a study of how the emerging politics of the Cold War were to finally irrevocably alter those class relations, as America rather than Europe was to dominate as a world power. Co-starring Christopher Reeve and James Fox.

results.title: The Reluctant world power
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
The third in a series which traces the development of American foreign relations. The period between 1914 and 1941 was one in which America was torn between the policies of isolationism and involvement outside its boundaries. Focuses on Wilson’s policies of involvement in European affairs during and after the First World War. A backlash caused a return to isolationism in the 1920s and 1930s which was followed by partial involvement in Europe at the beginning of World War II and America’s full commitment to the war in Europe and the Pacific in 1941.

results.title: The Reluctant dragon. The Furious flycycle
results.brief_description: The Reluctant dragon Once upon a time, a village boy made friends with a dragon - a pink dragon who preferred purring to breathing fire and writing poetry to fighting. But when St. George the dragonfighter arrives with the longest, wickedest spear you ever did see, what will happen? Based on the story by Kenneth Grahame. “The Furious flycycle” Melvin Spitznagle is a mechanical genius. When Professor Mickimecki, the inventor, moves to town, Melvin “borrows” the professor’s anti-gravity pellet and converts his bicycle to a flying marvel, just in time to perform an heroic rescue. Based on the story by Jan Wahl.

results.title: The Reluctant dragon (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Hamilton Luske
results.brief_description: A Walt Disney animated cartoon based on the story by Kenneth Grahame. Tells of a dragon and a knight who prefer to write poetry and drink tea than to fight. However, for the sake of tradition and to please the villagers, a somewhat unorthodox duel is staged.

results.title: The Reluctant delinquent
results.brief_description: Portrays the relationship of delinquency to learning disabilities using the case of Robbie Gamble, who is being held in a maximum security facility for juveniles. After many years of failure in school, he is learning to read in special education classes.

results.title: The Reluctant dagon; The Pied piper of Hamelin: a child's story
results.brief_description: These two classic children’s tales are brought to life in these enchanting puppet plays. “The Reluctant dragon” tells the story of a simple shepherd’s son and his discovery of a dragon in a cave. He is not dismayed or surprised that the dragon is friendly but they have some trouble convincing the villagers and St. George the dragon slayer. This version of “The Pied piper of Hamelin” is the winner of the BAFTA Best Children’s Programme Award and the Prix Jeunesse. Narrated by Robert Hardy.
